page.title: 01FARLEY VILLAGE
page.content: Farley is a small village five miles east of Salisbury.The houses are on a circular road one mile long.There is a variety of houses ,old and new, private and council. The church is Farley All Saints and was built during the 1680's. Opposite this are Alms Houses called Farley Hospital combined with the Wardenry built in 1681. Next to the church is the Primary School. There are forty two children and two teachers. It was built in 1867. There are eight farms in the village. Apart from pasture and arable land there is mixed woodland.There are many public footpaths. There is one shop and post office. Near this is the pub called the Hook and Glove. This is the only pub in Britain with this name.
